item1_summary:
CMS Energy has adopted an employee code of ethics, entitled “CMS Energy 2024 Code of Conduct and Guide to Ethical Business Behavior” (Employee Code) that applies to its CEO, CFO, and CAO . The Director Code is administered by the Audit Committee . CMS energy has also adopted a director codes of ethics entitled ‘2024 Board of Directors Code of Conduct’ (Director Code)
 Consumers believes this policy is reasonably designed to promote compliance with insider trading laws, rules and regulations . CMS Energy has adopted an employee code of ethics, entitled “CMS Energy 2024 Code of Conduct and Guide to Ethical Business Behavior” (Employee Code) That applies to its CEO, CFO, and CAO, as well as all other officers and employees of Consumers and its affiliates .
 Consumers has also adopted a director code of ethics entitled “2024 Board of Directors Code of Conduct and Guide to Ethical Business Behavior’s (Director Code) that applies to its directors . The Director Code is administered by the Audit Committee of Consumers . Any alleged violation of the Director Code by a director will be investigated by disinterested members .
 The information is incorporated by reference from CMS Energy’s and Consumers’ definitive proxy statement for their 2025 Annual Meetings of Shareholders to be held May 2, 2025 . The proxy statement will be filed with the SEC, pursuant to Regulation 14A under the Exchange Act, within 120 days after the end of the fiscal year covered by this Form 10‑K .
 The following financial statement schedules are included below . The accompanying notes are an    assessment of CMS Energy Parent Company . The financial statement schedules are included below: Schedule I — Condensed Financial Information of Registrant, CMS Energy—Parent Company at December 31, 2024 and 2023 .
 The accompanying notes are an integral part of these statements . The accompanying financial information are an integral part of these statements . The asset sheets are included in the confirmation of cash and cash equivalent assets acquired by CMS Energy .
 The company's condensed financial statements have been prepared on a parent-only basis . The accompanying notes are an integral part of these statements . In accordance with Rule 12 protocol S.A. of Regulation S., S.P.CMS Energy’s condensed financial financial statements have been prepared on a parent-only basis of presentation .
 The rent-only financial statements and other information included should be read in conjunction with CMS Energy’s audited consolidated financial statements . The expiration dates of these guarantees vary, depending upon contractual provisions or upon the statute of limitations under the relevant governing law . The maximum potential obligation consists primarily of potential payments to third parties under commodity purchase and sales agreements entered into by CMS ERM and other subsidiaries of NorthStar Clean Energy .
 The agreements included as exhibits to this Form 10-K filing are included solely to provide information regarding the terms of the agreements and are not intended to provide any other factual or disclosure information about CMS Energy, Consumers, or other parties to the agreements . Deductions represent write-offs of uncollectible accounts, net of recoveries .
 CMS Energy and Consumers may be found in this filing, at www.cmsenergy.com, at . www.consumers energy.com and through the SEC’s website . information about CMS Energy and Consumers can be found on the SEC's website at .sec.gov.com . CMS Energy is the parent of Consumers Energy and CMS Energy, and the parent company of Consumers .

 The U.S. Department of Energy issued the following statement . The statement was originally published in 1996 . The claim was filed in 1996 by CMS Energy and the U.N. Energy Department . The State of New York filed the claim in 1996. The claim is the result of an internal audit of CMS Energy’s finances .
 The Sixth Amended and Restated Revolving Credit Agreement dated as of December 14,2022 among Consumers, the Banks, as defined therein, and JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., as Agent (Form 8‑K filed December 15, 2022) The Extension to the Amended and Restated $250 million Secured Revolving Credit Agreement was filed November 19, 2019 .
 Consumers, as Issuer, and the Dealer party thereto (Form 10-Q for the quarterly period ended September 30, 2014) The CMS Energy/Consumers Clawback  includes CMS Energy’s certification of the CEO pursuant to Section 302 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 .
 CMS Energy Corporation has duly caused this Annual Report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized . This Annual Report has been signed below by the following persons on behalf of CMS Energy Corporation and in the capacities indicated and on February 11, 2025 . CMS Energy Energy Corporation filed Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2023 .
 Consumers Energy Company has duly caused this Annual Report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized . This Annual Report has been signed below by the following persons on behalf of the . undersigned . Garrick J. Rochow is the President, Chief Executive Officer, and Director. John G. Russell is the Director .
 Laura H. Wright, Deborah H. Butler and Kurt L. Darrow are directors . Ralph Izzo is Director of the University of Michigan . Ralph Darrow is Directorial Director of The University of Wisconsin . Deborah Butler, Laura Wright and Kurt Darrow have been Directors of the U.S. Department of Education since 1998 .
